page.title: 19ECOLOGY-SHIREBROOK VALLEY
page.content: { The Shirebrook Valley has provided a haven for many uncommon species of plants and animals but has been particularly noted for its wild birds for many generations. At the end of the l9th century it was stated that 77 varieties of bird had been seen in the area round the village of Woodhouse. This old list included kingfisher, heron and corncrake. Recently our school counted how many different varieties of bird we saw in our local Shirebrook Valley. We counted 53. We are proud of the fact that our valley is the breeding ground for uncommon species of grasshopper, sedge and reed warbler and the lesser whitethroat. There is a ringing station within the valley showing that the valley is an important thoroughfare for migrating birds which take shelter in the willow and hawthorn bushes.
